/>
V.iv.1.A.5.f
.
Definition:  Favorable Finding
As stated in
38 CFR 3.104(c)
, a
favorable finding
means a conclusion either on a question of fact or on an application of law to facts made by an adjudicator concerning the issue(s) under review.
References
:  For more information on
findings of fact and conclusions of law, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart ii, 1.A.1.c
, and
favorable findings, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 1.A.2
.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iv, Chapter 1, Section A - Completing the Rating Decision Narrative
citation: Part V, Subpart iv, Chapter 1, Section A
